bibl.title: The Camel, the Wagon, and the Donkey in later Roman Egypt.
bibl.note: From the fourth century to the eighth, the wagon, never in very common use, became still less common, while higher volume and longer distance donkey traffic was probably replaced by camels.
bibl.seg: Bagnall Roger S., The Camel, the Wagon, and the Donkey in later Roman Egypt.
From the fourth century to the eighth, the wagon, never in very common use, became still less common, while higher volume and longer distance donkey traffic was probably replaced by camels.
